messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:54): can someone explain to me what profiles "profiles was feedback from the TV industry at TPAC 2010 HTML WG F2F" is referring to in http://www.w3.org/2011/04/07-html-a11y-minutes.html ?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:55): on the face of things, "profiles" and "TV industry" in one sentence looks like something that's not One Webby
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): it's almost certainly what you're interpreting it as
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): (the tv industry doesn't understand "one web")
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:59): AryehGregor: I'm basically never the right person from Opera for any CSS WG stuff :)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:00): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I remember there being some TV people at TPAC, but I don't recall them asking for "profiles"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:00): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: hey, sup
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:00): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, just home from work
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:00): but sometimes the a11y telecon minutes are confused
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:01): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, are you based in SF / mountain view?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:01): yes
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:01): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I'll be in SF in 2 weeks
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:02): also, any thoughts on http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=12491 ?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): if you're up for coming up to mountain view, i'd be happy to invite you to lunch at google when you're here - drop me a line with dates that would work for you (i don't have my calendar right now)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): that bug seems reasonable

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:02): "<oedipus> plus 1 to judy -- W3C process different from "WG process" set up by chairs, but they are following cookie-cutter process which is detrimental to development of spec"
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I was planning to organise a lunch with some heads in SF
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:03): so who, these days, is thinking that the HTML WG Decision Process is good for the development of the spec?
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:03): KuraFire, paul_irish and some others‚Ä¶\
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: nobody being happy is not a good indicator of badness in this kind of thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: (but having said that, i do think it's bad :-) )
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:05): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I'll email a group when I've got my bizness together ;)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:05): cool
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:05): I was thinking saturday the 30th of April
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:08): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Presumably a majority of the chairs think it is good
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:08): Although it is possible that they all beleive it is bad but think that the others both think it is good I suppose
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:10): oh wow, it's late
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:10): nn
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:10): politics is the art of the possible
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:12): Which is another way of saying you think it is the best possible process
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:12): Presumably
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): politics shouldn't (and needn't) be a factor here, fwiw.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:17): The ridiculous HTMLWG process is one of the major reason I've reduced my involvement in that disfunctional group.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:17): It's not really clear that can be true unless you are using a different definition of politics
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:20): (in particular, even if you use a data-driven process, which is good, the weighting applied to different bits of data is basically a political decision)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:21): any process that involves more than one human is a form of politics
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:22): I think that is a broader definition of "politics" than most people would use
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:24): that was meant to be a non-tautological assertion, not a definition
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:24): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: yeah, because many people want claim that what they are involved in is not political in any way
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:24): ceding decision-making authority to somebody else is political decision
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:24): though Wikipedia's one-liner, "Politics is a process by which groups of people make collective decisions", seems pretty broad and about what I had in mind
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:32): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Ah, if you had narrowed the scope to "decision making process" that might be more reasonable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:33): I'm trying to think of interactions that involve more than one person which do not involve making any decisions, or even any attempts to influence decisions
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:34): I suppose if one person murders another in their sleep, solely for the thrill of it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:36): doooods! microsoft weren't first! google came up with 'native html5'! here's proof: http://www.html5rocks.com/tutorials/dnd/basics/
